page.title: 15THE GLYNDE LOCAL HISTORIAN
page.content: The local historian was born in Firle, but moved to Glynde as a child, when his parents took over the village shop. Although most of the houses in the village belong to the Glynde estates, he owns his. He has made a collection of old photographs and postcards. The houses have changed little, but the photographs of people showed how differently people dress now from the time before the 1st World War. A photograph of the school children included a little girl who is now the oldest person in the village. He told us that Glynde was once famous for the School of Lady Gardeners at Ragged Lands and for its creameries, a dairy which has now become a bottle recycling plant.
